name: perfectible
content:

able to be improved or made perfect: We remain obsessed with the idea that the human body is perfectible. They understand that nothing is perfectible and that progress may be temporary.
More examplesFewer examplesI still believe that even the most flawed political systems are perfectible.They believe that the system is perfectible, and that it could be reformed to create a sustainable way of living. Much of the literature is based on the idea of a perfectible ideal, which rarely exists in reality.
